messages.title: Our NHS: the fight goes on
messages.content: Steve McCabe is demanding a greater involvement for local people in the planning of health services in Birmingham. Our campaign for A&E services successfully halted the closure of the Katie Road Walk-in Centre. However, the fight is not yet over. Bank-engine use and growing demand on accident and emergency departments reinforces the argument to keep local walk-in centres open amidst the closures.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Work to bring jobs, businesses and apprenticeships to our area.
Stand up for our health service and demand a greater say for local people.
Support local schools and teachers so that our youngsters get a decent start in life.
Work with the police and others to tackle anti-social behaviour and make sure we tackle new kinds of offences like online identity fraud.
Always put the people of Billesley, Bournville, Brandwood and Selly Oak first.

mentions.tacticalSituation: Vote Labour to keep the Lib Dems out.

issues.health: Steve McCabe has been campaigning to give the area the hospital services it deserves.
issues.immigration: Listening to local people's views on immigration.

politicalExperience.achievements: Campaign for A&E services that successfully halted the closure of the Katie Road Walk-in Centre.

images.caption: Steve McCabe in front of the Emergency Department.
